field.name: summary
field.value: MonoRailHttpHandlerFactory.CurrentEngineContext is not initialised before processing is handed off to NotFoundHandler. DefaultViewEngineManager.ContextualizeViewEngine requires CurrentEngineContext to be initialised

field.name: description
field.value:
When a controller cannot be found to handle the current request, a NotFoundHandler is created to process the request and return the appropriate 404 page. The NotFoundHandler delegates to the current view engine manager if a custom 404 page is present (rescues/404). If the DefaultViewEngineManager is used, it adds the resolved view engine to the services associated with the current engine context via MonoRailHttpHandlerFactory.CurrentEngineContext.AddService(typeof(IViewEngine), engine); this requires the CurrentEngineContext to be initialised prior to this call. Currently context.Items[CurrentEngineContextKey] = engineContext; is executed after trying to resolve the controller and (on failing) handing off to the NotFoundHandler, resulting in a NullReferenceException.
Attached patch simply moves the context.Items[CurrentEngineContextKey] = engineContext; line to directly after the engine context is created (immediately prior to controller resolution). There is no tests associated with this patch as I am unsure how to test the handler factory to prove this scenario.
